column4: wals_: unfortunately when I insert a livecd I'm not given the option to boot from it. I don't know what is preventing it from booting. I just thought it could be /root being full because it appears to be and before it crashed I got messages about not being able to mount an external hard drive due to a partition being full. (The external hard drive has 60GB free).
did you make settings on bios?
yes. I'm running a dual boot on a Macbook Pro. So it is probably something to do with that.
I mean the dual boot might be why I can't run a liveCD. I used to be able to until the last time I upgraded. Now I can't
but the your bios settings can be the problem.
yeah I know. I've set my bios to boot from USB then CD then the hard drive.
so?
with the dual boot screen normally see a CD image I can choose from. But that doesnt come up anymore.
it won't boot from liveCDs or live USBs
if you choose the cd to start on bios, it shouldn't show the dual boot menu. It will show to you boot menu from live CD only.
but it doesn't
I can't tell you why or how. The Live CD I used worked previously and still works on other machines. And so did the live USB I have
give your mac model
MacBookPro3,1

I've looked through the forums regarding this issue when I upgraded to Ubuntu 12.04. In the end I gave up and did an upgrade. I don't like doing upgrades. I usually install the newest version. But that time I couldn't. System's been buggy ever since.
in your case, it's good to follow official tutorials
tutorials for what?

I don't know what the problem is. I know the symptom is that it stalls after the ubuntu logo comes up and a series of messages come up the last of which is something about cups but that has [ok] next to it. Then it stops booting.
macbook pro is prepare to run macOSX system, you should look on the bios and to set the option to run system non macOSX
pvt me
wait a sec. I don't know how to pvt you using this app...
what is the app you are using?
colloquy
click twice on my nickname
